fields.summary: Backup Manager failed with Export failed (Completed pre-export checks)

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce
 * Go to /admin/groups
 * Create a group with a long name (2850 chars seem to be enough to trigger the bug; 2700 chars are not enough).
 * After successfully creating the group, try using it in Jira (e.g., to assign project roles)

h1. Expected result

The group is available in Jira.
h1. Actual result

The group is not available in Jira.

The rest of the users and groups seem to synchronise correctly. The problem is contained to just that group.
fields.summary: Long group names cause directory synchronisation to fail

fields.description:
In the new Jira UI, there's no alternative to canceling the navigation helper. Also, once you've seen it, there's no option to view it again in case of doubts about the new navigation menus.

Would be useful if it has the option to cancel and to view again.
fields.summary: Add skip remind me later options for onboarding in Jira new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Text or tables are being compressed in the issue view.

h3. Environment
* The problem is reproducible only in new Jira layout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Opt-in in the new Jira layout
# Create an issue with a long description text or table - the problem is easily visible when there are tables.

h3. Expected Results
The content is correctly rendered:
 !sample-no-edit.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
If you have the *Edit Issue* permission, the content is compressed:
 !sample-edit.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
It seems the problem is related to the frame which surrounds each field on the issue view - for users who don't have the *Edit Issue* permission the content is properly rendered.
The frame surrounding the content in old Jira layout:
 !old-layout-frame.png|thumbnail! 
The same frame, but in the new Jira layout:
 !new-layout-frame.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use the old Jira layout.
fields.summary: In the new Jira layout, content from description or custom fields are being compressed

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
Currently, there is no field configuration available to determine the behaviour of a field once data is entered.

h3. Suggested solution
After entering data into a field, once you've exited the field the colour should change into a solid grey, indicating that the field has been completed and the data entered is valid.
fields.summary: Interactive fields

fields.description:
h2. Summary
In iOS JIRA App, it is not possible to view the *backlog* of a Kanban project. However, it is possible to view *backlog* for Scrum project.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create a board for a Kanban project
# View the Kanban board in iOS JIRA App
# The *backlog* button on the top is not there.

h2. Expected Result

There should be a *backlog* button on the top

h2. Current Result

There is no *backlog* button on the top
fields.summary: Can't view Backlog for Kanban project in JIRA iOS App
Better error messages when drag-dropping attachment fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When the user performs the Move Issue action in the Bulk Edit page. There is a checkbox which can be ticked that indicates "Use the above project and issue type pair for all other combinations." If the issue type that is being moved has parent issues which are different and the user picks this option, all the issue type will then push and point to only one parent issue which will be problematic to fix. The alternative is of course to un-tick the checkbox and manually change the parent issue for all the issue-types.
h3. Sample Picture

  !move-issue.png|width=1590,height=594!
h3. Suggested Solution

To avoid confusion, a warning is best to pop-up or included when ticking the checkbox ensuring the user that all the issue-type will point to only one parent issue, so the user is aware of the action being proceeded with and a clear distinction can be made on this.

or

Change the wordings to *Use the above project, issue type AND PARENT ISSUE for all other combinations*. This is clearer for the customer.

h3. Why this is important

This is to make sure the user does not accidentally change a great number of tasks in the project to be linked to the wrong parent type. This requires some work to reconfigure this mistake and bring in back to normal and it can be avoided easily.
fields.summary: Include Warning When Applying Bulk Update Move Issue Action

fields.description:
I moved a sub-task from one parent task to another parent task in the same project. The original parent task no longer shows the sub-task in its list of sub-tasks. The new parent does show the moved sub-task in its list. However, if I click on the sub-task, the breadcrumb at the top of the page still displays the original parent task instead of the new parent.

The sub-tasks were created as clones of sub-tasks of the original parent, then moved to the new parent issue.

Note, my Jira version information did not display a normal version number, it says:
{quote} 
h2. ...
h2. License Information for Jira
h3. Jira a1bf78e0

 
...{quote}
fields.summary: Moving a sub-task to different parent doesn't update the breakcrumb

fields.description:
Creating this documentation update request based on this comment: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67563?focusedCommentId=1686903&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1686903

As this user noted, the current documentation for Jira Cloud on [configuring an announcement banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-an-announcement-banner-776636247.html] does not take into consideration that this feature currently doesn't exist in the [New Jira experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience-937886012.html].
It would help if there were a banner or a warning at the top of this page to explain that for the time being this feature does not exist in the new experience.  And that there is a suggestion request to add this in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67563
And in the meantime if you need to use this feature in Jira Cloud, it appears you would need disable the new experience.
fields.summary: Update documentation on configuring announcement banner to indicate new Jira experience does not have this feature

fields.description:
When the user tries to log time in the issue, errors appear in the console.
Example of errors: 

{code} 
POST https://app.tempo.io/rest/tempo-timesheets/4/worklogs/ 500 (Internal Server Error)

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object
    at Function.keys (<anonymous>)
    at vendor.bundle.js:52
    at <anonymous>

Unhandled Promise Rejection: TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'Object.keys(r)')
{code}

To reproduce the error, we logged as the user and the same error of the video occurred.
fields.summary: Can't log their working time

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
JIRA does not allow to reorder the system fields and custom fields on the View Screen.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow users to reorder the fields according to the order they want to view it.

*Why is this important:*
When working with a lot of fields it makes hard to view/find the fields.

*Workaround:*
To use the default field rearrangement.
fields.summary: Allow the custom fields to be reordered on the view screen.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Bulk editing the due date in German language will return error. And the error message is empty:
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Use German language
# Bulk edit *Due Date* to March 1st

h2. Expected Result
The Due date get edited to March 1st

h2. Current Result
JIRA returns empty error message as shown in the image above.

h2. Workaround
Use a different language or change the Date/Time format to display months in number. For example, 1st March 2018 is shown as 01/3/2018
fields.summary: Can't bulk edit due date in German language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating table with an empty cell causes the field shifted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a table in *Description* field
# For example :-
||heading 1||heading 2||heading 3||
|col A1|col A2|col A3|
|col B1|col B2|col B3|
# Then , remove *col B2* value to make the field empty

h3. Expected Results
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-19 at 7.49.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
||heading 1||heading 2||heading 3||
|col A1|col A2|col A3|
|col B1||col B3|
 
h3. Work-around

Ensure there is at least one empty space where the cell contents were deleted to preserve the table structure.

||heading 1||heading 2||heading 3||
|col A1|col A2|col A3|
|col B1| |col B3|
fields.summary: Wiki Renderer for Table is not working correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14987].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When user interface language is set to French, the Release Date picker shows 'undefined'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new "Scrum software development" project
# Add a new release version in "Releases" page
# Change UI language to French
# Try to release the newly created version and open the Release Date picker to modify the date

h3. Expected Results
Release Date picker get displayed correctly

h3. Actual Results
See screenshot below
 !Date picker field.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* When using "Build and release", the Release Date picker get displayed correctly.
* Same issue can also be reproduced when UI language is changed to German or Russian

h3.Workaround
Change the UI language to English.
fields.summary: Release Date picker broken when interface language is set to French

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In ADG3, app icons' color is being displayed differently depending on the sidebar color.
!colors.png|thumbnail!  

The idea is to know the color based on the settings so that the app can adjust the icon, if need be.

It would be good if I could to configure icon URL in atlassian connect descriptor to get there an additional context (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/context-parameters/#a-name-additional-parameters-a-additional-parameters)

As example:

{noformat}
icon: {
  width: 16,
  height: 16,
  url: "/menu-icon.svg?textcolor={jira.lf.top.adg3.textcolour}"
}
{noformat}

h3.Notes
To use application properties I need to request customer's Jira instance and store colors for each instance to avoid requesting it every time. It's possible but inconvenient.

It would be good if I could get required colors right in icon request, to avoid additional requesting for {{/rest/api/2/application-properties}}

h3.Workaround
Use the REST endpoint {{/rest/api/2/application-properties}} and look for the entry where key is jira.lf.top.adg3.bgcolour
fields.summary: Context Parameter to get Sidebar color in ADG3

fields.description:
In the "new look" UI that's just been added to Jira, the filter panel is not really usable due to it's limited space.

The whole left panel is 306px wide, and of that, filter names only take up 127px (41% of space). The rest of the space is padding and white-space.

That means if you have filters such as:
 * testing phase - 1{color:#ff0000}.0{color}
 * testing phase - 1{color:#ff0000}.1{color}
 * development - {color:#ff0000}1{color}.0.x
 * development - 1.1.x

The filter names are cut off on the right hand side which means you can't tell which is which _(cut off area indicated in red)_.

In the previous version, you could drag the size of the left panel so that you could make sure that the text of the filters was visible, in the new look - that size is fixed and snaps back.

This means if you have a lot of filters you need to always drag open and snap back the left panel every single time you want to click a filter.

 

*Solutions:*
 # Remove the right padding/space from the filter title link and make it go almost to the right hand edge of the panel next to scroll bar.
 # Remove some of the left padding/space which is useless.
 # Add a hover/title over each link so you can read it by hovering.
 # Allow the left panel to be resizable.
fields.summary: Filter panel not resizable and contains too much padding in new-look ui

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

----

When the filter is shared with public (i.e., shared with *All users*), and owner of the filter edit it and tries to save the filter, it fails to save with error: _The filter *FilterName* could not be saved._

 !UIError.png|thumbnail! 

But, in the browser the response has move clear error message: _Dashboards and filters in this Jira instance cannot be shared with the public anymore. If you want to modify this item, you must change the Shares so that it is not shared with the public._
 !BrowserError.png|thumbnail! 
----

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide more specific error log to the user in UI which can help them identify the issue instead of providing general error.

----
h3. Workaround 

# Go to *Manage Filters* page.
# Click on 'Edit filter details' from the *'...'* against the filter, and share the filter with a specific group or project. 
# Now, edit the filter and save the changes.

----
fields.summary: Improve UI error message when the filters could not be saved

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the [new JIRA UI|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience-937886012.html], if a user don't have the *Browse Projects* permission in any permission scheme and try to navigate to https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa, the user will be stuck on the following screen since the left navigation menu will not load: 

* *Chrome*: 
!chrome_bug.png|thumbnail! 
* *Firefox*: 
 !firefox_bug.png|thumbnail! 
* *Safari*
 !safari_bug.png|thumbnail! 

On the old JIRA UI, the error message would display, but the user would be able to use the top menu bar to navigate to other sessions in JIRA without having to use the browser’s back button:

 !browse projects error_old UI.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In all permission schemes, make sure that none has the *Browse Projects* permission set to:
## *Any Logged in User* 
## *Anyone*
## A group where the test user is included
# Navigate to https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa

h3. Expected Results
A error message explaining about the missing permissions should be displayed, but the left menu should load allowing the user to navigate to other sessions in JIRA.
h3. Actual Results
The user will be "stuck" on the *secure/BrowseProjects.jspa* page and will have to use the browser’s back button to leave the page.
fields.summary: Left-side menu won't load when navigating to "secure/BrowseProjects.jspa" without having the "Browse Projects" permissions in at least one permission scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Time since chart gadget shows the wrong month when you rest the mouse over the bars in the Dashboard, it was reproduced using a date picker custom field or the field Due Date.

  !Timesincechart.png|thumbnail!!filter.png|thumbnail!

 

When you use fields such as Created date or updated it doesn't happen
h3. Customer Impact
h3. Environment

*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field type Date picker and add it to the screens (or just use the Due date field)
 # Fill the date field on some issues using different months. For example, put a couple of issues with a Due date on October, other 2 in November and other 2 on December
 # Create a new Dashboard by clicking on Dashboard > Manage Dashboard > Create Dashboard
 # Add the gadget Time since chart and configure it to:
 ** Filter: Add the project or a filter with the issues where you added the Due date
 ** Date Field: Due date (or a custom field)
 ** Period: Monthly
 ** Days Previously: 90
 ** Cumulative totals: No
 # Save

h3. Expected Results

It should show 3 bars with the 3 months: October, November, December with 2 issues each
h3. Actual Results

It shows 3 bars in the wrong months: September, October, November, (nothing in December) with 2 issues each

*Application logs:*
h3. Notes

When you use fields such as Created date or updated it doesn't happen
h3. Workaround

None so far
fields.summary: Time since chart shows the wrong month when using Due date or custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
CSV import of remaining estimate still shows in the Burndown chart even if the value has been manually changed (through UI)

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a CSV file to import issues in JIRA and an issue with a Remaining Time estimate of *12w 3d 3h*
# Import a CSV file with mapping the *Remaining Estimate Field*
# Edit the issue to have Original Estimate of 3h and Remaining Estimate of 3h. 
#*  !current values.png|thumbnail!  
# Issue *History* shows:
#*  !change of remaining estimate using CSV import.png|thumbnail!  
# Add the issue to a Sprint
# Start the Sprint
# Complete the issue
# Check the Burndown Chart for *Original Estimate* and *Remaining Estimate*

h3. Expected Results
The remaining estimate for the issue is considered as 3h

h3. Actual Results
The remaining estimate for the issue shows *12w 3d 3h*
*  !remaining estimate.png|thumbnail! 

The Original Estimate shows 3h
*  !Original estimate.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Manually editing the Remaining Estimate for field that was not imported using CSV works as expected;


h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: CSV import of Remaining Estimate field value still shows in the Burndown chart even if the value has been manually changed (through UI)

fields.description:
On the knowledge base article, *Adding a Custom Field*, there is a missing icon (Cog Menu) in the first step:
!cog-menu-icon.png|thumbnail! 

The affected article is: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-a-custom-field-720412132.html

Additionally, here's an example how it should be:
!cog-menu.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: One icon is missing on Adding a Custom Field article

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The default "Comments from emails" mail handler prevents an issue from being created if a  _Forward Email_ is set and the said mail handler comes first in the list of *Mail Handlers* at the {{IncomingMailServers}} section in Jira:
- https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a setup like this:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-18 at 12.26.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the first mail handler to switch its position to make sure the default *Comments from emails* process the message first:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-18 at 12.31.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Set a fwd email address to the *Comments from emails* mail handler.

h3. Expected Results
The message will be first processed by the *Comments from emails* mail handler, which will throw the following error in logs:
{code}Comments from emails - Cannot handle message as destination project has not been configured.{code}
If there isn't any forward email address set, the next mail handler will attempt to process the message, which will most likely succeed, and the following logs will show up:
{code}Create Issue - SOUP - Issue SOUP-14 created 	 	 
Create Issue - SOUP - No Issue found for email 'A new test email ' - creating a new Issue. 	 	 
Create Issue - SOUP - Issue Key not found in subject 'A new test email'. Inspecting the in-reply-to message ID. {code}

h3. Actual Results
If a fwd email is in play, the message will not be processed by the second mail handler in the list.
fields.summary: Default mail handler prevents issue from being created if Forward Email is set

fields.description:
*Problem*

When creating a ticket/adding a comment by e-mail, and using HTML markup with the text color value in white, and the background in a different color (e.g. black), the wiki markup will only handle the text color, hence, the text will be invisible since the default background color is white.

*Suggestion*

The wiki markup should support background color change, or maybe not convert white text color from the HTML markup.
fields.summary: Wiki markup and background color HTML markup

fields.description:
h2. Summary

For issue webhooks, the content of the webhook (the representation of the issue) will be localized according to the language preference of the user who created or updated the issue. As webhook consumers may not use the same language, it makes more sense to always send webhooks in the system language.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new issue updated webhook
# Change your user language preference to a non-English language like Spanish or German
# Update an issue
# Observe the webhook that is sent. Notice that the issue type names, descriptions, and possibly resolution values are localized.
fields.summary: Webhook content should not be localized

fields.description:
For now, there's no way to disable the incoming email in a cloud instance.

Would be useful if Jira has a button/feature that easily disables the incoming email.
fields.summary: Add a disable incoming email button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, issue collectors can be created per project. It is not possible to create only one issue collector that could route the issues to the project the user selects.

h3. Suggested Solution

As an admin, I would like to set up a single issue collector, in which the user could select the project in which she/he wants the issue to be created.
fields.summary: Ability to create a single issue collector that routes issues to projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logging out in IE11, a duplicate of the current page will appear within a couple of seconds in the middle of the screen.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click in Cog Icon > Log out.

h3. Expected Results

The system should log out you correctly.
h3. Actual Results

There's a duplicate screen in the same page.
h3. Workaround

Use another supported browsers (e.g. Google Chrome). See [Supported Browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html].
fields.summary: IE11 Error when loggin out

fields.description:
Accessible through CAC, this public document [Create a project in your new Jira experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/create-a-project-in-your-new-jira-experience-937885967.html] is supposed to provide concrete information about what is shared when a project is created through *shared configuration link* under the title *Create a project that shares its configuration with another project*. 
h3. Current situation: 
{quote} 

Projects that share configuration share:
 * issue types
 * workflows
 * screens
 * fields
 * roles
 * versions
 * components
 * permissions
 * notifications
 * *and more*{quote}
h3. Expected behaviour: 

There is no meaning of the last point *and more* since the customer needs to know clearly what is really shared. 
Note: This documentation for server environment is clearer [Defining a project for Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/defining-a-project-749382822.html]
There is no cloud version for the latter document.
fields.summary: Documentation on creating project with shared configuration

fields.description: Currently, there is no way to add color to Select List custom field values. I'd to have the ability to change the color of those similarly to the way the add-on [Color Custom fields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ru.andreymarkelov.atlas.plugins.colorfields/server/overview] does for Jira Server.
fields.summary: Ability to add color to custom field dropdown options

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you hover over a user name in various areas of Jira, a balloon is displayed with a button *Activity*. If you click the button you're redirected to the users' profile, where you used to be able to see a user-specific Activity Stream. However, this Activity Stream is not available in the New Jira Experience. 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open an issue.
# Hover the mouse over the name of the assignee.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to see a balloon with the user details and a button that could be i.e. 'User profile'.

h3. Actual Results

A balloon is displayed with a button 'Activity'.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

No workarounds.
fields.summary: Activity button still available in the New Jira Experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As described at [JIRA Quick Search and the issue key prefix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-quick-search-and-the-issue-key-prefix-646250925.html] "_The Quick Search box (at the top-right of your JIRA screen) can sometimes find issues when you type just the number ... This is due to the concept of a 'selected project'... If you have recently done actions in a project like viewing an issue, that project becomes your 'selected project'. JIRA tries to 'guess' which issue you are looking for, given the 'selected project'_."

Behaviours observed:
Scenario: you want to search for the issue AIM-123 using the quick search, if you have the project AIM set as your selected project it should be possible to find the issue using only *123* but once you do a *quick search* Nothing is returned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter the project where the to be searched issue is
# Quick Search using only the issue number
# Nothing returned

h3. Expected Results
 * The issue with the issue number related to the 'selected project' should return as the result of the quick search

h3. Actual Results
 * No issues returned

h3. Workaround
* Use the Advanced Search or the quick search including the project key in the query
fields.summary: Quick Search not looking for issue number when inside the project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Shortcut C used to create issues in new JIRA experience doesn't work for some customers

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Turn on the *New Jira Experience*
# Use the shortcut *C* to create an issue

h3. Expected Results
Create issue window pops up

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

 
h3.Workaround
Switch back to the old UI from *Profile* > *Turn off for now*
fields.summary: Shortcut C used to create issues in new JIRA experience doesn't work for some customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever trying to search for a *Label* on *Quick Search*, the expected outputs will not be returned. 

Behaviours observed:
Scenario: you have a Label called *123*. Once you do a *quick search* Nothing is returned.
** If you search for the same label on *advanced search*, it'll return all your issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a label
# Quick Serch it
# Nothing returned

h3. Expected Results
 * Only issues where the label is populated would be returned, as the quick search should be looking any kind of text entry.

h3. Actual Results
 * No issues returned

h3. Workaround
* Use the Advanced Search and query labels = 'label'
fields.summary: Quick Search not looking for Labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All the users are appearing in the assignable user list on the [New Jira Issue View|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] independently if the users have the *Assignable User* permission or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a group and add some users to it.
# Add the Assignable User permission for this group in the permission scheme.
# Remove any other user from this permission.


h3. Expected Results

When editing the assignee of an issue through the board, using the New issue view, you can see in the assignable users' list the users that are members of the group that has the Assignable User permission.

h3. Actual Results

When editing the assignee of an issue through the board, using the New issue view, you can see all the users on the assignable users' list.

Some errors are thrown in Console when changing the assignee:

{code}batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:9299 PUT https://onejiratorulethemall.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/TUMIPRO-2 400 ()
{code}

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

For JIRA Software Boards, it's *temporarily* possible to disable the New JIRA Issue View in the users' profile, using the following option:

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

Only the Assignee search in the new JIRA Issue View is showing this problem. Trying to actually assign to a non-assignable user will not succeed.
fields.summary: Assignable User permission not being respected in the New Jira Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever trying to search for a *Label* on *Quick Search*, the expected outputs will not be returned. 

Behaviours observed:
Scenario: you have a Label called *123*. Once you do a *quick search* Nothing is returned.
** If you search for the same label on *advanced search*, it'll return all your issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a label
# Quick Serch it
# Nothing returned

h3. Expected Results
 * Only issues where the label is populated would be returned, as the quick search should be looking any kind of text entry.

h3. Actual Results
 * No issues returned

h3. Workaround
* Use the Advanced Search and query labels = 'label'
fields.summary: Quick Search not looking for Labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to copy value from Time Spent to a custom field with data type as number

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field with data type *Number Field*
# Create a post functions *Copy Value From Other Field*
# On *Add Parameters To Function* page
* Source field: Time Spent
* Destination Field: _The custom field created in #1_
# Save the workflow and perform the transition

h3. Expected Results
Value from Time Spent is copied to the custom field

h3. Actual Results
* UI prompted with the following error

!Test-2-2.jpg|thumbnail!
* Log showing below entries
{code}
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long cannot be cast to java.lang.Double at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.NumberCFType.getDbValueFromObject(NumberCFType.java:51) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType.updateValue(AbstractSingleFieldType.java:198) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.updateValue(ImmutableCustomField.java:465) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.updateValue(ImmutableCustomField.java:435) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowUtils.persistChangeAndLog(DefaultWorkflowUtils.java:459) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowUtils.setCustomFieldValue(DefaultWorkflowUtils.java:448) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowUtils.setFieldValue(DefaultWorkflowUtils.java:266) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowUtils.setFieldValue(DefaultWorkflowUtils.java:257) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.CopyValueFromOtherFieldPostFunction.executeFunction(CopyValueFromOtherFieldPostFunction.java:88) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.AbstractPreserveChangesPostFunction.execute(AbstractPreserveChangesPostFunction.java:48) at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:1007) at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1404) at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.doAction(AbstractWorkflow.java:533) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowActionInsideTxn(OSWorkflowManager.java:1042) at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowAction(OSWorkflowManager.java:999) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.transition(DefaultIssueService.java:508) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.transition(DefaultIssueService.java:484) at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.workflow.SimpleWorkflowAction.doExecute(SimpleWorkflowAction.java:28) at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165) at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:67) at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39) at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31) at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16) at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently for "Days Previously" setting in "Time to First Response" gadget only can set 300 days or below.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow more than 300 days settings.

h3. Why this is important
Customer needs to set number of days more than 300 days.
fields.summary: Allow to set more than 300 days for "Days Previously" setting in "Time to First Response" gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
I have color blind moderate disability. I found this morning your new Jira sw version has all labels with a faded red/green color. I am unable to distinguish them. Please, keep in mind people with color disabilities when designing your interfaces. The previous one was just fine.
Thanks.

h3. Workaround

As for priority icons, try the setting below:

# Go to https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
# Change the shape of the arrow icons to ones have a distinguishable shape as below:
** /images/icons/priorities/blocker.svg
** /images/icons/priorities/critical.svg
** /images/icons/priorities/major.svg
** /images/icons/priorities/minor.svg
** /images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg

 !Screenshot 2018-12-18 11.33.51.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Color blind people

fields.description:
h3. Description
 * As a security improvement, it would be good to have a way for users to request Google to remove eventual pages that might be searchable through Google. This would allow users to hide their content from the internet, which I believe is a solid improvement.

h3. Where would it be applicable?
 * The process of requesting Google to remove pages from their index consists in following the steps described below:
 # Navigate to [Webmaster Tools|https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/home?hl=en]
 # Insert the base url (e.g. example.atlassian.net)
 # Click *Add Property*
 # Download the HTML verification file
 # Upload the file to the instance (e.g. http://example.atlassian.net/)
 # Confirm successful upload by visiting http://example.atlassian.net/<file.html> in your browser.
 # Click *Verify*

Once verified, the user can request Google to remove desired pages from indexing.

h3. Actual behavior:
 * Currently, there does not exist a way of uploading the file, so it is not possible to request Google to remove any links that might be indexed

h3. Proposed solution:
 * Include a field, which could be located under *Site Administration*, thus only being accessible by admins, where users could upload the file.
 * This file could be reached through the URL http://example.atlassian.net/<file.html>, thus allowing users to verify that the domain is owned by them.
fields.summary: Ability to Upload file from Google's Webmaster Tools to remove pages from Google Index

fields.description:
Some issues get too many attachments and it becomes difficult to identify the user that has added it.

Would be useful if there were a way to sort the attachments by users or if it the attachments have more than one field to add it. For example, it could be an area for the attachments added by the reporter, assignee, developers, etc.
fields.summary: Two (or more) areas for attachments in Issues
"Table of contents" for the users on start page of the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_There are no active sprints_ warning is shown on burn down gadget if the selected sprint is not available on the selected board.

h3. Environment
*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add burndown gadget to dashboard
# Select a board and a sprint
# Edit the board's filter to exclude the sprint selected on step above

h3. Expected Results
The warning should inform the sprint is not available on board or automatically change it to 'next sprint'

h3. Actual Results
_There are no active sprints_
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
* Edit the gadget
fields.summary: There are no active sprints warning on burndown gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Current JIRA [Look and Feel Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-look-and-feel-of-your-jira-applications-780861527.html] is missing settings for Time Format

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the *Look and Feel* page in JIRA
# Look for the Time Formats

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to change the Date/Time Format

h3. Actual Results
 Date/Time Format settings are missing
*  !date time formats.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Switch to the *New JIRA Experience* where it is possible to change the Date Format. 

 !date time formats new jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Current JIRA "Look and Feel" is missing settings for Time Format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an admin, I would like to setup default user roles at the system level that would be inherited in the project. However, the role could also be changed at the project level. 

For example, I add a new developer named Joe in Jira User Management and I would like to assign him the default user role of a developer. When add Joe in the People section at the project his role defaults to developer but I can also override Joe's permission.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to configure user roles in the User management.
fields.summary: Ability to setup default user roles at the system level

fields.description:
In JIRA Cloud, the feedback form appears to be broken. The form only asks for name and email (there is no field for the feedback text) and after submitting this message error appears:

"Oops! Something went wrong…
There was a problem submitting your feedback, likely due to the configuration of this form. You might want to contact the site owner to let them know about this issue."

After clearing Browser's Cookies and Cache and trying another time, it works with a different appearance.
fields.summary: Feedback form is broken

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Activity Stream that used to be available in the users' profile in the old UI is not available in the new Jira experience. 

 !activity.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

As an admin, I would like to have the Activity Stream in the users' profile in the new UI.
fields.summary: Add the Activity Stream to the profiles in the New Jira Experience

fields.description:
The keyboard buttons and the UI buttons are not in sync. 

The UI has K (Previous) and J (Next), but on the keyboard the buttons are left - right. 

Do understand that the QWERTY keyboard is standardized across the world, so the easy thing to do is swap the buttons on the UI. Please refer to the attachment.
fields.summary: UI for 'Next' & 'Previous' buttons

fields.description:
Background/example problem:

I been looking in to a new workflow for our company. So I been experimenting in a separate unused workflow. Today i realised that some of the changes done is transferred to other workflows also. This is is not what I expected.

 

Suggestion:

I think you should keep the workflow separate or make it clear when doing changes that effect other workflows
fields.summary: When renaming a status in a workflow do not rename that status in other workflow

fields.description:
On the bottom of issue pages in the JIRA SAS appears a text field and a bunch of tabs. Adding a comment via the field only updates the comments tab, not the history tab. If it is in front, the user may think their comment wasn't saved, leading to duplicate comments.

!comment.png!
fields.summary: Commenting does not update history until page reload

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Audit logs are of very high value for some customers like information security and auditing businesses. Currently maximum retention period of six months is not enough. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to increase retention period to up to a year or more.
h3. Why this is important
Some businesses need and rely on audit logs to be available for longer periods to comply with business policies.
fields.summary: Jira audit log retention period needs to be increased

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an attachment (not image files) is added to a ticket, when attempting to mention the attachment on the ticket clicking in the 'attachment' button -> selecting the attachment. The attachment is always mentioned with thumbnail even when the file isn't an image, which causes an error (Unable to embed resource: ...) once you add the comment with the attachment mentioned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue
# Add a not image file to the issue
# Try to add a comment mentioning the file by click on the attachments button under the comment box and selecting the not image attachment

h3. Expected Results
The attachment would be mentioned in the following format since it's an image:
{noformat}
[^attachment_name.txt]
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The file is automatically mentioned as thumbnail which results in an error when adding the comment as thumbnail since the file isn't an image
{noformat}
Unable to embed resource: attachment_name.txt of type text/plain
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
- Manually change the mentioned format in the attachment as below:
{noformat}
[^attachment_name.txt]
{noformat}

- Once you refresh the page, the mentioned is properly added with the correct format and no longer adds as thumbnail
fields.summary: When mentioning recently added attachments through the attachments button, the comment is automatically added as thumbnail

fields.description:
Currently, Jira displays only the backlog and the next column on the Kanban board. I want to have two separate visual columns, for example, one for main, priority items and one for bugs.

 !Screen Shot 2017-12-13 at 17.53.01.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Kanban user, I want to have more than one column in the Kanban backlog view
Board is not loading a filter query

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There's no field for adding feedback description/details when choose "Give Feedback" in JIRA old interface in Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Mozilla Firefox browser, in JIRA old UI click on "Give Feedback" icon next to "Help" icon
# A popup window (Help us improve JIRA) will appear where there are fields for Name and Email address, but there is no field for feedback description/details
# Fill the fields for Name and Email, and click "Submit"
 !Give Feedback in Mozilla Firefox.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* A page/window with a field to enter feedback

h3. Actual Results
* There is no field for feedback, and clicking on submit gives the following error message:
 !Something went wrong.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Change to JIRA new user interface (Experience new JIRA)
* Choose different browser (i.e. Google Chrome)
fields.summary: There's no field available for feedback, when choose "Give Feedback" in JIRA old interface in Mozilla Firefox

fields.description: Links created through markdown in comments\issue descriptions are opened in current active tab as opposed to the standard of target="_blank"
fields.summary: Links should open in new tab

fields.description:
Users having issues when uploading files. Please find screenshots.

Occurs very often on some tickets, but mainly for Mac users.
Occurs on Safari and Chrome (use Firefox is not allowed in our company devices).
fields.summary: Attachment on ticket not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing any Jira with the new UI in Safari, the CPU utilization of the thread running that tab will hold the running CPU core at 100% for several seconds. This does not happen when using other browsers like Firefox, Chrome.

h3. Environment
Safari Version 11.0.2 (12604.4.7.1.4)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In Safari, browse to any Jira page and take note of the thread that is running the tab in the activity monitor.

h3. Expected Results
The Browser thread to consume a nominal amount of CPU (for example Chrome jumps up to about 25% for less than a second.

h3. Actual Results
 You will see it jump and hold at 100% for several seconds after loading the page.
 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to use another browser such as FireFox or Chrome.
Disabling styles, however, this turns Jira unusable.
fields.summary: Jira new UI consumes 100% of the running CPU core when running in Safari

fields.description:
When view the reporter details on jira.atlassian.com, the email is not showing as expected. As shown in the following screenshot:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-12 at 16.14.31.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Reporter details with "at" and "dot" instead of "@" and " . "

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It would be useful if we could add hyperlinks to the description of a release.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to add hyperlinks to the description of releases.
fields.summary: Ability to add hyperlinks to the description of a release

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently it is not possible to preview a PDF file attached to a Jira issue

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open an issue
# Attach a PDF file
# Once the file is attached, click the file icon to preview it

h3. Expected results
File preview is displayed

h3. Actual results
Message saying *{{Ouch! We can't load the PDF.}}* is displayed

h3. Environment
It occurs on both Safari and Chrome.

h3. Additional information
In the below video, is possible to see how the errors occur.
fields.summary: Attached pdf preview not working

fields.description:
Would it be possible to create a validator which would require a specific value to be filled on a field?

 

e.g. The issue can only be transitioned to *Done* if the resolution is configured as *Completed*.

 

This functionality would avoid users to select the wrong resolution for an issue, depending on the use case that he should be able to perform.
fields.summary: Validator to require a specific value for a field (Including Resolution field)

fields.description:
The public documentation [Associating field behavior with issue types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/associating-field-behavior-with-issue-types-776636450.html/] contains some inaccurate information about how to associate an *Issue Type* with a *Field Configuration*.

On step 3, a *Configure Field Configuration Scheme* page is mentioned, as it states:
{quote}
Click the *Configure* link for the field configuration scheme in which to create an association between an a field configuration and an issue type. The *Configure Field Configuration Scheme* page will appear, showing the scheme's current mappings of field configurations to issue types.
{quote}
 
This might cause some confusion, as the documentation induces the user to click in *Configure* (bold), which is wrong. Instead, what actually needs to be done is the following:
 # Click the *Field Configuration Scheme* associated with the field configuration you would like to associate an issue type with. 
  !Screen Shot 2017-12-12 at 13.59.28.png|thumbnail! 
 # In the *Configure Field Configuration Scheme* screen, click *Associate an Issue Type with a Field Configuration*
 # Select the desired issue type and field configuration and click the Add button.

Please fix this documentation to provide the correct steps in order to prevent further confusion.
fields.summary: "Associating Field Behavior with Issue Types" documentation update
POST /rest/api/2/user returns misleading message upon specific condition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is a system workflow in Jira called "Builds Workflow" which uses the "Building" and "Build Broken" status, but both of these statuses are missing from the default status list
 
h3. Notes
This will cause users to not be able to drag and drop issues in board if the project use this workflow

h3.Workaround
Contact support to perform the workaround
fields.summary: "Building" and "Build Broken" status are missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we set a *Date Time Picker* in an issue, it will show fine in the view issue screen. However, Jira Issue Calendar gadget can show the issue on a wrong date, depending on the _Default user time zone_ set in the instance.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the _Default user time zone_ of the instance to i.e. GMT-5;
# Set the date in a Date Time Picker custom field (upon creation) to be Dez 11, at 7 pm;
# In the Calendar gadget the issue shows on Dez 12;
# If we check the date and time in the database, Jira seems to be considering the GMT (Z) instead of the users' GMT.

h3. Expected Results
* Calendar gadget shows the date as Dez 11.

h3. Actual Results
* Calendar gadget shows then date as Dez 12.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Calendar Gadget considering GMT instead of the default user time zone for Date Time Picker values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Backup file created is only displayed to user who created it/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Cog > System > Backup Manager*
# Click *Create backup for cloud* 
# Once the process is finished, ask another admin to go to *Cog > System > Backup Manager*

h3. Expected Results
 * File would be available for download
 !backup.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 * Download link is not displayed
  !Screen Shot 2017-12-12 at 12.45.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
 * Right-click the link, select *Copy link address* and share it with the user who wants to download the file
fields.summary: Backup file only displayed to user who created it

fields.description:
A trailing whitespace in the jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format setting (for example, "%e/%b/%y %H:%M ") avoids customer to start a sprint-dialogue.

Jira just reports a message, but it very difficult to understand that the whitespace is the root cause for this problem.
fields.summary: Jira gets a warning message when a trailing whitespace is set

fields.description:
In the new Jira design in Jira cloud, when we are in the "Search Issues" page, the icon of the button "Change view" is white, so it's no intuitive to see .

 

!image-2017-12-12-11-31-39-348.png!

If we the put the mouse cursor over the icon,  it is shown better.

 

!image-2017-12-12-11-34-25-521.png!

 

Could you change the "Change view" icon to a different colour in a next Jira cloud release?
fields.summary: Search Issues - "Change View" icon  change

fields.description: I opened several Jira windows at once and hand to click through the tour of "What's new" (2017-12-11) on every tab. I saw it once, I'd like to be able to quit the others without going through it again, very tedious.
fields.summary: Add a way to quit the "what's new" tour

fields.description:
Our documentation on Jira REST API is throwing a {{404 Not Found}} error as of today.

h3. Steps to reproduce
Access the URL of the latest version of the API: https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/1000.1568.0

h3. Workaround
The most recent available documentation is https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/1000.1557.0
fields.summary: Jira Cloud REST API Reference documentation throwing a 404

fields.description:
When you create a Jira issue that contains header markup (e.g. "h3."), it looks completely different when viewed full page vs the two panel split view (as seen when browsing the backlog in the Scrum board).
*  !headers.png|thumbnail! 

H2s, for example, are large when viewed in the side details view (but lacks top margin) but the same H2 (on the same ticket) looks MUCH smaller when viewing the same issue full page.
 !Image 2017-12-06 at 1.56.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Image 2017-12-06 at 1.56.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve headers style (H1, H2, H3, etc) in Jira across views

fields.description:
IDEA: Add a "Select All" Checkbox to Status Drop-Down for search and filtering

We have a TON of Statuses...and it looks like you guys do too (screen shot below). 

When setting up a filter, its *such a pain to select EACH status individually*, vs just *"Selecting All" and un-checking the unwanted status* which would be SO much easier.   

!image-2017-12-11-14-02-12-196.png!

Thanks!

Summer
fields.summary: Add a "Select All" Checkbox to Status Drop-Down for search and filtering

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

After setting up a field type Text Single Line the users are not able to change it to Multi-line when they want to add more text due to the characters limit.

*Suggested Solution:*

Allow the users able to change the Custom Field type from Single Line to Multi-line.

*Why is this important:*
When working with a lot of Issues, changing the values manually takes a long time to do it.

*Workaround:*
Users should change the value of a Text Single Line creating a new Custom Field (Multi-line) and after insert the new value.
fields.summary: Change the type of a text custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Group cannot be removed from a role when it has uppercase on user management and on the role it has lowercase.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group using lowercase.
# Add the group to a role
# Delete the group
# Create the group again with the same name, but the first letter as uppercase
# Click "Remove" on the "People" tab

h3. Expected Results

The group is successfully deleted, even though you refresh the page.

h3. Actual Results

It says that the group was removed, but if refresh the page, it will show again.

h3.Workaround

Contact support.
fields.summary: Group cannot be removed from a role when it has uppercase on user management and on the role it has lowercase

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a Jira Admin, I want to be able to mark different fields in the option *Configure fields>Custom* per issue type.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option to make it possible to mark different fields in the option *Configure fields>Custom* for each issue type.

h3. Why this is important

With this feature, we wouldn't need to build screen schemes for every issue that can technically share fields.
fields.summary: Ability to mark different fields per issue type in the Configure fields option

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When the instance is expire and if the user proceeds to install an add-on, there is no error message or warning message that indicates the user that the instance is expired and therefore the user won't be able to install the add-on. There are cases when the user is not aware of the expiry of the instance or the correlation of add-on not being able to be installed after the expiry is not made explicitly clear.
h3. *Expected Results*

A warning message that indicates that the add-on cannot be added due to the fact that the instance has expired.
h3. *Actual Results*

The add-on processes the installation and adds the add-on into the Managed Add-On page but the add-on itself can't be used. When clicking on the Free Trial button, the license is processed for a long while and then simply nothing happens with no indication why it failed at all.
fields.summary: Warning For Expired Instance When Installing Add-Ons

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JQL filter for Webhooks is not applied to _Comment_ events.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook as follows
#* Issue related events
#** JQL: {{project = <PROJECTKEY>}}
#** Comment: created, updated, deleted
# Add a comment to an issue from a project *different* than the one specified in the JQL.

h3. Expected Results
The webhook shouldn't be fired.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook was fired.
 
h3. Workaround
There is no workaround in Jira that will enable filtering of webhooks for Comment events. Webhook listeners need to implement filtering on their side.  

h3. Notes
At the moment of creating of this bug report, JQL filter for Webhooks is also not applied to _Attachment_, _Worklog_ and _Issue Link_ events, as tracked in [JRACLOUD-59980|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59980]
fields.summary: JQL filter for Webhooks is not applied to "Comment" events

fields.description: If you have only a Jira Account, you can see there are comments on the Jira task in bit-bucket but to actually view the comments a Bitbucket account is required. Being a Project Manager, I need to see the comments on the task but not necessarily Bitbucket code (and have a full paid Bitbucket account). Is there a way to attach the Bitbucket comments to the Jira Task.
fields.summary: No Visibility to BItbucket Comments with Jira Account

fields.description:
h3. SummaryStyle

When the close issue permission has not been granted to a user, the user is still able to close issues. This also happens when all users have been removed from the close issue permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Got to the permission scheme for your Jira service desk project.
 # Remove all permissions granted to close issues on the permissions scheme
 # Create a new issue
 # Transition through the issue to close.
 # The issue is successfully closed when the "Close" transition is clicked.

h3. Expected Results

The user should not be able to close the issue. An error messaging should popup saying the user does not have access to close the issue since they do not have close issue permission. 
h3. Actual Results

The issue is successfully closed.
h3. Workaround

A workaround this is using post functions validators or conditions to restrict permission to those who can close the issue.
fields.summary: On JSD when close issue permission is restricted or revoked from everybody, issues can still be closed by Anybody

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * If two custom fields of the same name are created, the description of one of them is displayed incorrectly.

h3. Customer Impact
 * Minor

h3. Environment
 * Cloud: JIRA v1000.1210.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a test instance, create 2 custom fields of the same name, e.g. *Custom Test No 1* with description _Description 1_ and *Custom Test No 1* with description _Description 2_.
 # The first *Custom Test No 1* is added to a screen e.g. *BUGP01: Software Development Bug Screen*. This field will be shown when an _Issue Type_ of _Bug_ is created.
 # The second *Custom Test No 1* is added to a screen e.g. *BUGP01: Software Development Default Issue Screen*. This field will be shown when an _Issue Type_ other than _Bug_ is created. Screenshot below.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Change the description of the first *Custom Test No 1* to _Description A_.
 # Open the _Create Issue_ screen and choose the _Issue Type_ of _Bug_. Observe the description of *Custom Test No 1*.
 # Open the _Create Issue_ screen and choose the _Issue Type_ of anything other than _Bug_. Observe the description of *Custom Test No 1*.

h3. Expected Results
 # When the _Issue Type_ of _Bug_ is chosen, the description should show _Description A_.
 # When the _Issue Type_ of other than _Bug_ is chosen, the description should show _Description 2_.

h3. Actual Results
 # When the _Issue Type_ of _Bug_ is chosen, the description still shows _Description 1_.
 # When the _Issue Type_ of other than _Bug_ is chosen, the description correctly shows _Description 2_.

!image-2017-12-12-18-30-58-256.png!!image-2017-12-12-18-32-56-070.png!

*Application logs:*
 None
h3. Notes

None
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Custom Field Description: Incorrect description displayed when two custom fields of the same name are created

fields.description:
Today, whenever I capture a screenshot on my high-res display (either my MacBook Pro or my desktop PC with a 4K display), when the image is pasted into JIRA the images are *huge*, making the JIRA issue difficult to read because users must horizontally scroll to see images. 

As a result, I waste a lot of time every week resizing images by 50% in an image editor before pasting into JIRA. 

JIRA should make it easier to deal with retina-quality screenshots so that they'll be displayed normally in the issue, where "normally" means 50% size.  JIRA already has an ability to set the size of an image e.g. 
{code}
!foo.jpg|height=300!
{code}

But using this requires knowing the height of the image, which takes almost as much time as resizing the image itself in an editor. If JIRA simply supported "50%" for a height, then it'd be trivial to reduce the size of images shown in wiki markup without actually having to edit the image in an image editor to resize it. 

Another option would be to, on browsers on a retina display, offer a checkbox on the "paste image" dialog box which, if checked, would automatically add the appropriate height= to reduce that image by 50%.
fields.summary: Make it easier to include retina screenshots in JIRA issues

fields.description:
When a permission scheme is setup to archive projects, which has no permissions granted to it, the archived projects are still visible by _Jira administrators_ on the {{secure/BrowseProjects.jspa}} page, whereas in the old Jira experience they were only visible by Jira administrators on the admin section of projects, {{secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa}}.

This suggestion request is to add the ability to hide these projects from the {{secure/BrowseProjects.jspa}} even from Jira administrators since these projects are already available at the administrative section, {{secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa}}.
fields.summary: Hide archived projects even from Jira administrators on the BrowseProjects section

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
Customers are not able to change the Priority field after the Issue already created.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow customer able to edit the field Priority even with the Issue already created.

*Why is this important:*
In case the customer has set the field incorrectly it’s possible to change its value. The priority field causes an impact for other areas like: amount of tickets by level under the dashboards / people working urgently to check the L1 Issue that is not L1/ etc.

*Workaround:*
Customer needs to inform someone that has access to change the field Priority to change it.
fields.summary: Enable Customer To Edit The Field Priority

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When performing a CSV import, JIRA will check if the *Assignee* or *Reporter* field has a user that doesn't exist in *User Management* and create a user for it. At the end of the import, JIRA will prompt to leave the users as *Inactive*. Even though that is checked, the users will be *Active* after that.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Perform a CSV Import, where the CSV file contain a user is not an existing user in the instance.
# At the end of the import, click *Leave them as Inactive for now* option.

h2. Expected Result
The users should be set to *Inactive*.

h2. Current Result
The users will be marked as *Active*.

h2. Workaround
Leave the *Assignee* and *Reporter* field unmapped. JIRA will not check for the users and won't create any users.

h2. Additional Note
This bug is similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67816
fields.summary: CSV Import will not mark user as Inactive, even though it is checked

fields.description:
When using the [Jira Cloud for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.slack/cloud/overview] integration, I'd like to have an option available where I could setup my personal *jirabot* app to send *DM* notifications when: 
* I'm mentioned on the comment or description sections of JIRA issues 
* I'm set as the *assignee* 
* I set as *watcher* on the JIRA ticket

Currently, the *user mention* feature works (on comments and descriptions) by sending e-mails when a user is mentioned, but I'd prefer to receive notifications directly on Slack. The same applies when the notification scheme is setup to notify the assignee or notify when someone is included as a watcher, I'd prefer to be notified on Slack instead of receiving an e-mail. 

{quote}
*Emailing an issue to users by mentioning them*

When creating, editing or commenting on an issue, you can easily email other JIRA users a link to the issue by mentioning these users in the issue's Description or Comment field.

- To mention a user on an issue:

* Create, edit or comment on an issue.
* In the issue's Description or the Comment field, type '@' and then the first few characters of the JIRA user's username or part or all of their full name (registered with their JIRA user account).
(!) As you start typing, a list of suggested users will appear in a dropdown list below the field (if you have the Browse Users global permission).
* Complete typing the JIRA user's username or choose from the list of suggested users in the dropdown list.
(!) When you submit the field, JIRA will send that user an email message indicating that you mentioned them on that issue.
{quote}
fields.summary: I'd like to receive DM notifications on the jirabot app when I'm mentioned on JIRA issues

fields.description:
*Summary*

The Gadget *Sprint Health Gadget* does not show information under the Wallboard mode.

 

*Steps to reproduce*

1. Configure the Sprint Health Gadget on the Dashboard

2. Change to Wallboard mode

3. That other Gadgets show its information, but the *Sprint Health Gadget shows a blank screen.

*It occurs selecting any of the layouts.

!Sprint_Health_Gadget_Wallboard_Mode.png!

 

*Expected Results*

It’s expected that the gadget information shows the same information as shown on the Dashboard.

 

*Actual Results*

The gadget shows a blank screen.

 

*Workaround*

Use the Dashboard view.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget not showing data in Wallboard mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When performing a search in JIRA, loading a board, or browsing issues, there are some performance issue which cause slowness.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the search performance in JIRA
fields.summary: Improve the performance of search in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user search for issue on below screen
https://xxx.atlassian.net/browse/XXX-14?jql=issuetype%20%3D%20Story
and clicks on one story to another story on listing panel at that time it shows two add-on panels. One panel from first issue(which is first clicked) and second panel from another issue(which is last clicked).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a filter or search for issues
# Navigate through issues
# There are instances wherein iframes of the same app are displayed twice. One for the previously selected issue, the second is the current one

h3. Expected Results
Display only the current issue's

h3. Actual Results
 !_TEST-6__double.jpg|thumbnail! 
 !_TEST-6__two_qmetry_iframes_created.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
[~iragudo]
* Was able to replicate almost consistently when I moved to a slower internet connection
* Happens to both old and new (ADG3) UI

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the page fixes the issue.
fields.summary: Add-on panel shows twice on issue page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Users with Confluence application access are unable to view issues 

h3. Steps to replicate
# New user with Confluence-only application access
# Create JIRA Project
# Set Browse permission to Group (Anyone)
# Create new Issue under the project.
# View the issue

h3. Expect Result
Confluence-only users are able to view the issue

h3. Actual Result
User with Confluence only application access are unable to view the issue even though Public Users can view them.
 !screenshot-1.png!
fields.summary: Users with Confluence application access unable to view JIRA Issues with browse permission set to anyone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65503].
  {panel}

When sorting results of issues by clicking on column header of any text field , the resulting sort order is technically correct but counterintuitive for users with languages that have certain special characters included in its alphabet:
The sorting is currently as follows:
First the text with upper case first letter (A-Z) occur
then the text with lower case first letter (a-z) occur
then the text with special characters, sorted on similar manner (upper case first, lower case after).

Examples for this are Polish, German and Spanish.

The suggestion is that these special characters should be sorted according to the alphabet of the language currently in use.
 * An specific example in Spanish: the six characters with diacritics Á, É, Í, Ó, Ú, Ü are treated as the original letters A, E, I, O, U, therefore when sorting, it should be A, Á...E, É...I, Í...O, Ó.
 * See [Wikipedia: Alphabetical order of different languages|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alphabetical_order]
 * [Polish alphabet|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_alphabet].
fields.summary: Change the sorting of special characters in the issue navigator according to the language currently in use

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing issues from CSV, the users set in the reporter/assignee field within the CSV will be imported to the instance. You're prompted to select if you want the users to be imported as active or inactive. The users are being automatically imported as active regardless of the option selected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a CSV file with a reporter column and a summary
# Import the file using the External System Import
# Map the Summary and Reporter fields
# Select to import the users as inactive

h3. Expected Results
The users will be imported as inactive following the option that you've selected

h3. Actual Results
The users are imported as active with application access

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: CSV importing users as active even when selecting to import them as inactive
Unpublished Workflow Draft Tooltip to show author and date

fields.description:
Currently, it's only possible to change themes in Confluence. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/working-with-themes-724765503.html

For JIRA you can only customize its look and feel (the sidebar). 
It would be great if customers were also able to customize their own theme/skins.
fields.summary: Customize Jira with themes/skins

fields.description:
h3. Problem: 
Currently, when I'm reviewing all Child issues of a feature I cannot tell what the status of that issue is. It would be very helpful to have it show the same information that is shown for issues linked to Epic. 

h3. Child issues: (not nice) 
 !image-2017-12-07-11-38-59-392.png! 

h3. Epic issues (nice) 
 !image-2017-12-07-11-40-34-235.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Include Status and Assignment information to Child issues view in Issue Details View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA new interface, after subscribing to Confluence, the application navigator doesn't create a link for Confluence and only notify to try to subscribe, even if the user already has a Confluence license.

h3. Environment
(!) Jira e7618fc4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to Confluence on a JIRA Cloud instance
# From JIRA open the application navigator and try to access Confluence


h3. Expected Results
A Confluence application link will be ready to be used and access confluence

h3. Actual Results
A link to subscribe to Confluence is displayed
 
h3.Workaround
Create a new application navigator link or revert to classic interface
fields.summary: Confluence Application navigator missing for New Interface

fields.description:
Whenever I try to attach a file while editing an existing issue it fails.

There is no permissions error since I've tested it in the permission tool. Also I can add an attachment to an existing issue while in the sprints detail view. The error just occurs when we try to edit the issue.

This is manifested through several projects and users, but one example project is https://hallpressen.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=32&projectKey=ITH&view=planning&selectedIssue=ITH-2257.\\
fields.summary: Can't attach files to issues when editing

fields.description:
As a developer working on a Jira Integration I would like to ease the install process of the integration for our users by reducing the number of manual steps they need to perform. One of these steps is finding the customfield(s) created (and managed) by the integration and changing the renderers from the default of plain text to wiki markup.

 

It would be super cool if this could be done as part of the customfield creation API call for multiline text (text area) and other applicable types.
fields.summary: Change customfield Renderer Type via REST API

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
 Users from different environment instances (one On-Premise and other in Cloud) do not connect each other to receive notifications from the created/updated issues when creating it through e-mail.

*Suggested Solution:*
 Allow users from different instances be able to connect each other to receive notifications from Issues created by e-mail.

*Why is this important:*
 Allow the instances to connect each other will let us informed about the issues updates.

*Workaround:*
 Users need to contact someone that has access to the project/issue to know about the status/updates of this.
fields.summary: Connection between instances from different environments
